document_data.name: ''Order of the Open-Eyed Owl''
document_data.History: ''Order of the Open-Eyed Owl'' was a play about [[knight]]s and by the mid-14{{th}} century DR, undamaged copies of the playbook were valued at twenty [[gold]] [[coin|pieces]]. A copy of the play was preserved within the once-wondrous [[Bard Keep]], a temple and library dedicated to [[Oghma]], that fell into ruin in the mid-13{{th}} century DR. The [[book]] was stored within the Concert Hall and hid a page with the [[Dethek]] "O" rune, part of the set that was required to control the Keep's moving rooms.
